meanings.definition: A person whom one knows and with whom one has a bond of mutual affection.
meanings.sent1: My best friend and I love to play together.
meanings.sent2: I met my friend at the park for a picnic.
meanings.sent3: My friend always makes me laugh with their jokes.
meanings.sent4: A true friend is like a shining star in the dark night.
meanings.sent5: Having a loyal friend by your side can make life brighter.

meanings.definition: A person who is not an enemy or opponent; an ally.
meanings.sent1: My friend helped me carry my heavy bag.
meanings.sent2: It's always nice to have a friend to talk to when you're feeling down.
meanings.sent3: I consider my neighbor a friend because we always wave to each other.
meanings.sent4: In times of trouble, a true friend will stand by you like a sturdy oak tree.
meanings.sent5: A friend in need is a friend indeed, as the saying goes.

meanings.definition: To add (someone) to a list of contacts associated with a social networking website.
meanings.sent1: I will friend you on the social media platform so we can stay connected.
meanings.sent2: She decided to friend her classmates on the school's online network.
meanings.sent3: Don't forget to friend your relatives on the family group chat.
meanings.sent4: He wanted to friend his favorite celebrity on the social networking site.
meanings.sent5: It's common to friend people you meet at events to keep in touch.
